inference:
The quilt is divided into 9 equal squares. 4 of the squares are shaded triangles, so the fraction of the quilt that is shaded is:

$$\frac{4}{9}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$\frac{4}{9}$} I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: We can slide the triangles without changing their shape or area until one row of squares is shaded.  This shaded row is one of the three rows of squares in the figure.  Thus, the shaded area is $\boxed{\frac13}$ of the area of the quilt.
